title: Belly Pan - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.

If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components may be hot to the touch. Contact with the hot components may cause damage to exposed skin. To avoid skin damage, always allow the hot parts to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Release the fixing for the catalytic converter heat shield and remove the shouldered washer.
Move the heat shield forward to detach it from its locating lugs and remove from the motorcycle.
Release the two fixings that secure the rear belly pan mountings to the sump.
Carefully slide the belly pan forward to detach it from the front mounting grommets.
Front mounting grommet (right side visible, left side similar)
